issue.title: The remarks for shared_ptr::operator* should apply to cv-qualified void as well

blockquote.p: Remarks: When T is void, it is unspecified whether this member function is declared. If it is declared, it is unspecified what its return type is, except that the declaration (although not necessarily the definition) of the function shall be well formed.

discussion.p: This remark should also apply when T is cv-qualified void (compare LWG ).

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4567.

blockquote.p:
[…]
-4- Remarks: When T is (possibly cv-qualified) void, it is unspecified whether this member function is declared. If it is declared, it is unspecified what its return type is, except that the declaration (although not necessarily the definition) of the function shall be well formed.
